result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia Annell Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to any sentence.  Court recommends the defendant to the AODA Treatment Program.

Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived.  Any mandatory costs and surcharges are to be paid out of up to 25% of prison accounts and due in full by October 13, 2016.  Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia Annell Collins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patricia Annell Collins in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Patricia Annell Collins in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence.  Court recommends the defendant to the AODA Treatment Program.  Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived.  Any mandatory costs and surcharges are to be paid out of up to 25% of prison accounts and due in full by October 13, 2016.  Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Patricia Annell Collins not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was not produced.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target

Defendant Patricia Annell Collins in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Patricia Annell Collins in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is adviseddue to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/23/15 @ 1:30 pm
